intro: Eclipta linearis, commonly known as slender eclipta, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in a composite head, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eclipta linearis is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
